{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3355937,"name":"Steven Carmain","username":"Steven_Carmain","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/f07891/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-04-09T02:59:52.703Z","cooked":"

I’m curious if there is a way to support smaller AprilTags to use on a test field. Ideally, I was thinking like a Lego League table size (4x8’) with a Romi, and sticking tags on the walls. Can we use 2x2" sized tags, and have the camera scale to that size? How did the libraries support the change from 6" tags in 2023 to 6.5" tags in 2024?

I want to use PhotonVision on the Romi PI, but maybe a custom Python pipeline using WpiLibPi might be better here (not sure I could support the camera calibration part though). It seems the tag layout file could support this smaller field, we would just have to shrink all the numbers and keep it in meters.

FRC in 2024 used the 36h11 family of tags, which defines the size/patterns. You can read more about it here: What Are AprilTags? — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

If you want something smaller, you can implement a different tag family. There are libraries for many common programming languages to do this.

Your answer is definitely partly wrong.

I agree the tag pattern needs to be generated by the library. This gets all the squares in the right pattern to generate the proper ID.

The size is independent though. FTC used the same 36h11 tag family, but they used 4” tags instead.

The tag size is definitely independent of the tag shape/family. Doing a little more research, the tag size is only used for pose estimation. There is a config class you can use to set the tag size, so I might be able to use the Rio based detection to do what I want.

Maybe tag size could be added to the field JSON file. Maybe per tag size might be cool too, in case FIRST wanted to vary tag size for more important tags to see further away.

github.com

package edu.wpi.first.apriltag;

import edu.wpi.first.apriltag.jni.AprilTagJNI;
import edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Transform3d;

/** Pose estimators for AprilTag tags. */
public class AprilTagPoseEstimator {
  /** Configuration for the pose estimator. */
  @SuppressWarnings("MemberName")
  public static class Config {
    /**
     * Creates a pose estimator configuration.
     *
     * @param tagSize tag size, in meters
     * @param fx camera horizontal focal length, in pixels
     * @param fy camera vertical focal length, in pixels
This file has been truncated. show original

Edit: It looks like FTC already has variable size tags…. See: FIRST Tech Challenge AprilTag Testing Samples — FIRST Tech Challenge Docs 0.2 documentation

Tag Description Size of Tag in Inches (millimeters)
Tag ID: 583 (AKA “Nemo”) 4 in (101.6 mm)
Tag ID: 584 (AKA “Jonah”) 4 in (101.6 mm)
Tag ID: 585 (AKA “Cousteau”) 6 in (152.4 mm)
Tag ID: 586 (AKA “Ariel”) 6 in (152.4 mm)

I really need to stop commentibg when half asleep…

Yeah, you’re right. The tag size does matter, but it can be configured to match, so it’s independent of the tag family.

I never got there. I believe that since both the WpiLib Vision and PhotonVision are running at the same time, the WpiLib Vision took control of the camera before PhotonVision could get to it.

I would follow this guide, it should kill the WpiLib vision on the Romi, so PhotonVision could take over: Romi Installation - PhotonVision Docs
